title: Interesting duo or bad idea
body: Just have to ask anyone ever think of or use{{champion:74}} /{{champion:268}}  as a lane duo or pairing?How do you think they would be together?

replies.body:
1) Heimerdinger offers extreme push capabilities, the only downfall to heimer is he is easy to focus and cant carry more than a couple of turrets around.
2) Azir blocks out one massive entry way, patching up heimer's weakness
Azir soldiers can be summoned on to tower after poking them to hell to do massive siege.

good comp in theory, try it and see if it works.
well this guy would know he is a diamond player

If the enemy team has {{champion:110}} or {{champion:15}} or {{champion:51}} or a support {{champion:40}} or {{champion:76}} or {{champion:12}} or {{champion:201}}  or {{champion:117}}  or {{champion:99}} or {{champion:44}} its gonna be a hard lane for both of ya
Weakness: Enemy adc could play passive with a sustain support. They would scale better than you both.

i've done it a ton in normal games with my friend it works extremely well. i have also done heimer Alistar.  YOu just push the lane and sit behind turrets and soldiers when ganked. you can use wall to separate them and peel and you usually end up doing pretty well.

It absolutely has the potential to be the most annoying duo lane of all time.
Not certain of how the laning will go, BUT if the team feeds it has superb anti siege potential.

not too good
I cant see them working in a duel lane

i thought the duel lanes were mid/top... 1v1 u know?

i think it would be fun to try :D

Well, Azir support has been tried, and it's not bad. He's pretty mana efficient. However, Heim will push the lane. No questions. Yeah, he can bully the lane, but he'll just get ganked to no end. 

I guess it could work, if Azir was warding far enough out for them to escape. 
I can try it later and let you know. 

See where the weaknesses might be other than that.
